intro: Fumana spachii var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular fumana, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique appearance and adaptive traits. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
